dmca.title: [ThePlanet-C2583791N] Pirated movie hosting
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern:

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the Digital
Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your claim.

Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/index.html?p=copyright.
 
Legal Response Team
THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.

-----Original Message-----
From: abuse@ev1servers.net [mailto:abuse@ev1servers.net] 
Sent: Monday, January 15, 2007 11:00 PM
To: DMCA
Subject: [ThePlanet-C2583791N] Pirated movie hosting

==== Forwarded Ticket ====
1. Pirated movie hosting
Added by system at Monday, Jan 15 2007 09:50 am
X-MailFrom: info@strictlybroadband.com
X-RcptTo: abacus@abacus.ev1servers.net
Received: from [70.87.6.111] by [216.12.192.78] (abacus) for
<abacus@abacus.ev1servers.net>; Mon Jan 15 09:49:19 2007
Received: from mail.theplanet.com ([216.185.111.52]) by smtp02.theplanet.com with
Microsoft SMTPSVC(6.0.3790.1830);
  Mon, 15 Jan 2007 09:49:11 -0600
Return-path: <info@strictlybroadband.com>
Delivery-date: Mon, 15 Jan 2007 09:49:12 -0600
Received: from mx02.inside.filter.theplanet.com ([172.16.214.181]
helo=mx02.filter.theplanet.com)  by mail.theplanet.com (envelope-from
info@strictlybroadband.com)  with esmtps (TLSv1:DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA:256)
 (Exim)
 id 1H6U59-0006ja-P9
 for abuse@theplanet.com; Mon, 15 Jan 2007 09:49:11 -0600
Received: from poppy.gocontent.com ([213.201.210.24] helo=smtp.gocontent.com)  by
mx02.filter.theplanet.com (envelope-from info@strictlybroadband.com)  with esmtps
(TLSv1:DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA:256) 
        (Exim) 
        id 1H6U59-000LS9-6D 
        for abuse@theplanet.com; Mon, 15 Jan 2007 09:49:11 -0600
Received: from [10.0.0.241] (kurai [87.194.64.244]) 
        by smtp.gocontent.com (Postfix) with ESMTP id 7895E29E473; 
        Mon, 15 Jan 2007 15:45:32 +0000 (GMT)
Message-ID: <45ABA23D.9070501@strictlybroadband.com>
Date: Mon, 15 Jan 2007 15:48:13 +0000
From: Strictly Broadband <info@strictlybroadband.com>
User-Agent: Thunderbird 1.5.0.9 (Windows/20061207)
MIME-Version: 1.0
To:  abuse@theplanet.com
CC: Rob Johnson <Rob@interactiveworld.com>,  abuse@just-the-name.co.uk,  Janice
Singleton <janice@netcollex.net>
Subject: Pirated movie hosting
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1; format=flowed
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
Received-SPF: pass (mx02.filter.theplanet.com: domain of strictlybroadband.com
designates 213.201.210.24 as permitted sender) client-ip=213.201.210.24;
envelope-from=info@strictlybroadband.com; helo=smtp.gocontent.com;
X-OriginalArrivalTime: 15 Jan 2007 15:49:11.0730 (UTC) FILETIME=[B358D920:01C738BC] 

MIME element (text/plain)
Attention: ThePlanet.com 
 
One of your customers, anothersite.co.uk is hosting a pirated version of a video
that is copyright to the Sport newspaper, and which Strictly Broadband has exclusive
rights for on the Internet. I'm referring to the Keeley Hazell home porn movie,
which I'm told is available at the following address (although it's not currently
responding) -
http://forum.anothersite.co.uk/showthread.php?t=135332 
 
They claim to have distributed over 100,000 free copies, of a product that we are
selling at between £5 and £8. 
 
Note that we and the Sport intend to take legal action to retrieve damages against
both web sites and hosting companies that infringe our copyright. 
 
I have also CC'd just-the-name.co.uk, who host the DNS for anothersite.co.uk, as
they may be considered accessories to large-scale piracy. 
 
Regards,
Jerry Barnett
020 7267 5600 
 
--
Strictly Broadband
Hardcore Movies on Demand
www.strictlybroadband.com
